meanings.definition: The feeling or state of being irritated or bothered.
meanings.sent1: Her constant talking was an annoyance during the movie.
meanings.sent2: The dripping faucet was a constant annoyance in the quiet house.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics turned into an annoyance when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing mosquito was an annoyance that kept her awake all night.
meanings.sent5: The persistent ringing of the phone became an annoyance that she couldn't ignore.

meanings.definition: Something or someone that causes irritation or frustration.
meanings.sent1: The slow internet connection was a major annoyance for the entire office.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with traffic jams every morning was a common annoyance for commuters.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door became an annoyance that everyone in the house tried to fix.
meanings.sent4: His constant complaints were an annoyance that wore down even the most patient people.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending paperwork became an annoyance that seemed to multiply every day.
